intro: Chasmanthe spectabilis, commonly known as the flame lily, is a striking ornamental plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, sword-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces clusters of bright orange or yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Chasmanthe spectabilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
